content:
Hey, hiking is cool. I moved to Bellingham WA in March 2020 (great timing! ðŸ¦ ðŸ˜·) and discovered pretty quickly that, hey, hiking is cool. I’m a creature of habit, though, and if I didn’t have something kicking me out of a rut I’d probably hike the same handful of trails over and over. Don’t get me wrong, almost every hiking trail around here is stunning, but some variety is nice.
Enter the yearly Backcountry Essentials Trail Challenge. Every year in late April / early May this excellent local outdoors shop publishes a list of ten hiking trails on Instagram, and if you do eight of them before the end of September, you get entered in a giveaway for some gear. (I did eight last year just under the wire and picked up a pink double-wall mug that I use constantly.) The gear is really a bonus, though; the main benefit is (a) added motivation to get out consistently, (b) a list of sweet mostly-new-to-me trails to check out. (I think one last year was one I’d done before, none this year.)
It’s fun, motivates me to take a few pictures, and pushes me to get out and see new places. The trails are almost always stunning, and often less crowded than the North Cascades’ greatest hits. Here’s 2022’s trail reports, in which I tried to get creative with layouts etc:
Fragrance Lake via Two Dollar Trail Baker Lake GPS track part 1 GPS track part 2 Chuckanut Ridge Trail GPS track Thunder Creek GPS track, descent only Park Butte GPS track, descent only Mt. Dickerman – this one was ambitious (as anticipated) but very enjoyable GPS track, 3,898 ft of clumbing over 9.41 mi route as planned: 7.77 mi round trip 4,184 ft ascent 20.4% avg grade on ascent Still to come:
Yellow Aster Butte (route plan) 8.25 mi round trip 3,495 ft total ascent 13.6% avg grade on ascent, with a 16.5% grade Ã— 1.73 mi section out of the trailhead, and a 28.6% grade Ã— 0.25 mi scramble up to the false summit towards the end Chanterelle Trail – technically, already did this one with the kid in a backpack, but didn’t make it all the way to the lookout (route plan) 4.34 mi round trip 1,150 ft total ascent 9.4% avg grade on ascent Ptarmigan Ridge – waiting for more snow to melt! (route plan) 9.84 mi round trip (as mapped, probably won’t go this far) 2,615 ft total ascent Up and down, but the longest ascent section is only a 9.7% avg grade Shannon Ridge (route plan) 7.06 mi round trip (as mapped, probably won’t go this far) 2,767 ft ascent 14.8% avg grade on ascent 2021 hikes are scattered around my IG profile.
title: BCE Trail Challenge 2022

content:
I’m a data scientist, dad, coffee enthusiast, budding hiker, and extremely poor skiier living in Bellingham, Washington, USA. I have a background in engineering (Penn Bioengineering BSE ‘07/MSE ‘17) and psychology, with academic research experience in human memory and social media, personality, and mental health. I continued working on social media and mental health in industry at Qntfy, now part of SonderMind, where I currently work on matching prospective clients to mental health providers.
My publication list can be found here.
Outside of work, I like to experiment with espresso (longer post coming soon, videos available on my YouTube page), and Iâ€™ve taken up the de rigeur PNW outdoorsy activities of hiking (great!) and skiing (fun but hard! Iâ€™m awful!). Currently (Aug 2022) working my way through the BCE Trail Challenge 2022, and psyching myself up to figure out parallel turns on skis this winter.
Icon by Bec Hurley
summary: I’m a data scientist, dad, coffee enthusiast, budding hiker, and extremely poor skiier living in Bellingham, Washington, USA.
title: About

content:
After neglecting my web presence for way too long, supercres.net is in the process of being revamped using Hugo (and the Congo theme), hosted on Github Pages, with Github Actions to rebuild. I recommend the setup; I’m finding it way easier to edit in VSCode, commit, and push than to log into a CMS.
I just got really tired of finding a decent static-looking Wordpress template.
I’m also using this to disseminate more widely a portrait of myself I commissioned from Bec Hurley that I really like; highly recommended.
Naturally the site isn’t even at its proper URL as I write this. It’s being transferred from my old host now (whom I used for over 20 years!).
Update Aug 3: Finally got the domain switched over. We’re live!
summary: After neglecting my web presence for way too long, supercres.
title: The next iteration of supercres.net

content:
A work in progress web presence. About me.
Kulshan (Mt Baker) from Park Butte in WA, USA, July 2022
summary: A work in progress web presence.
